Wing¶

class components.liftingsurfaces.wing.Wing(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This class will create the wing geometry based on the required: Wing Area (class I output), Aspect Ratio (class I input), taper ratio (assumed), dihedral angle (assumed), wing twist angle (assumed) and airfoil selection. It also can perform an avl analysis on the wing to obtain the linear value of C_L vs alpha and the pitching moment vs. angle of attack.

Returns:

ParaPy Geometry of the Main Wing Surface
Parameters:
  • wing_loading (float) – This is the required wing loading from the class I weight estimation in [N/m^2]
  • weight_mtow (float) – This is the required MTOW from the class I weight estimation in kg
  • stall_speed (float) – This is the stall speed of the wing from the class I weight estimation in m/s.
  • rho (float) – This is the ISA STD sea level density in kg/m^3.
  • fuse_width_factor (float) – This is the assumed factor of the semispan which the fuselage extends over the wing.
  • hide_bbox (bool) – This is a switch to hide/show the bbox of the wing section within the fuselage.
  • hide_mac (bool) – This overwrites input from LiftingSurface to hide the Mean Aerodynamic Chord part
  • mesh_deflection (float) – The default value is an optimum between a good quality render and performance.
  • color (tuple) – Changes the color of the wing skin to the one defined in MyColors
  • ply_number (int) – Changes the number of ply’s of carbon fiber pre-preg.
alpha_cases[source]¶

” Here we define the run cases for AVL. We are running input cases alpha from 0 to 10 with 25 data points at the speed required for the controllability curve (1.2 x v_s).

Returns:AVL List of RunCases
Return type:Case
avl_data_grabber[source]¶

Here, we grab and sort the data by angle of attack from AVL.

Returns:Sort AVL data
Return type:dict
avl_results[source]¶

” Here, the results are extracted and stored in the memory of ParaPy.

Returns:Dictionary with AVL Results
Return type:dict
avl_session[source]¶

” Here we define the AVL session with the cases above.

Returns:AVL Run Session
Return type:Session
center_of_gravity[source]¶

Location of the center of gravity w.r.t the origin (root airfoil leading edge).

Returns:Location of CG w.r.t. Root LE in SI meter
Return type:Point
color¶

Changes the color of the wing skin to the one defined in MyColors

This attribute names the component ‘wing’.

Returns:String with wing component name
Return type:str

This defines the external shape for the ExternalBody class in definitions.

Returns:Wing ParaPy Geometry
Return type:Fused
fuse_width_factor¶

Below is the assumed factor of the semi_span which the fuselage extends over the wing.

get_wingfuse_bounds[source]¶
” This attribute is obtaining (the dimensions of) a bounded box at a fuselage width factor of the semispan
which will be used to size the local fuselage frames. These frames drive the shape of the fuselage.
Returns:HT center section bounding box
Return type:bbox
hide_bbox¶

Below is a switch to hide/show the bbox of the wing section within the fuselage.

hide_mac¶

Overwrites input from LiftingSurface to hide the Mean Aerodynamic Chord part

” This part creates the bounding box for the part of the wing within the fuselage.

Returns:Wing fuselage frame bbox
Return type:Box

” This part mirrors the right wing across the X-Z plane to make the left wing.

Returns:ParaPy Left Wing Geometry
Return type:MirroredShape
lift_coef_control[source]¶

This is the Required C_L from the lift equation at 1.2*stall_speed @ MTOW for the controllability curve of the scissor plot.

Returns:Lift Coefficient for Controllability Curve of Scissor Plot
Return type:float
lift_coef_control_index[source]¶

” This attribute returns the index of the AVL data corresponding to the case when C_L is closest to the required C_L by the lift equation at 1.2 * V_s for the controllability curve in scissor plot.

Returns:Index of data set with C_L for Controllability curve of Scissor Plot.
Return type:int
lift_coef_max[source]¶

This attribute computes the C_L from the lift equation at the provided stall_speed to be used in later performance estimations.

Returns:Lift Coefficient at Stall (C_L_max)
Return type:float
lift_coef_vs_alpha[source]¶

This estimates the lift curve slope.

Returns:Lift Coefficient Gradient [1/rad]
Return type:float
mesh_deflection¶

Below is the chosen mesh deflection. It’s is an optimum point between a good quality render and performance

moment_coef_control[source]¶

” This attribute gets the pitching moment of the wing about its aerodynamic center from avl corresponding to index found from the above lift coefficient at 1.2* V_s.

Returns:C_mac at 1.2*V_s
Return type:float

Instantiating the required variable name for the class ExternalBody

ply_number¶

Changes the number of ply’s of carbon fiber http://www.ijera.com/papers/Vol4_issue5/Version%202/J45025355.pdf

position[source]¶

Overwrites the inherited position attribute, to make the wing-fixed at Point(0, 0, 0), thus the datum of the entire model is the leading edge of the wing-root

rho¶

Below is the ISA STD sea level density in kg/m^3.

wing_cut_loc[source]¶

” This calculates the spanwise distance of the cut, inside of which, the wing is inside the fuselage. This location is where the wing bbox to size the fuselage frame(s) ends in the spanwise direction. The height of this bbox is the maximum thickness of the wing at this cut location.

Returns:Spanwise distance from root chord to cut location
Return type:float

” Here we define the AVL geometry.

Returns:AVL Wing Geometry
Return type:Geometry
wing_loading¶

Below is the required wing loading from the class I weight estimation.

wing_surface[source]¶

” Here we define the wing surface using a symmetry plane at y=0. Here the number of vortecies and their chordwise and spanwise spacing is also set.

Returns:AVL Wing Surface
Return type:Surface

” Here the results are written into a .json file named ‘avl_wing_out’.

Returns:AVL output data file
Return type:json
